nodes.text:
-------------------------------
|          CHAPTER 7          |
-------------------------------


You are walking behind Math in a single line. He is leading you somewhere only he knows,
through a narrow, twisting trail carved into the rock. 
Quite often it becomes a tunnel and sometimes you have to lower your head. 
It steadily goes uphill, and after a half hour, you are wheezing again. 

$R"Seer's Rock..."#$C Corolla mumbles. $R"Do you know something about it?"$C
Theo shakes his head. 

$c"Why don't we ask him...?"#$C you propose. 

$Y"I don't trust him!# This place is cursed!# We won't get out of here alive!"#$C Smiurl starts whining again. 

Seemingly deaf to your conversation, Math keeps on leading you forward. 

$m"Please, this way."#$C He says at every junction. 

After an hour or so, climbing into the rock, the trail suddenly ends,
revealing a surprising scene.

You just entered a wide cavity that must lie at the top of the spire. 
It looks a bit like the mouth of a volcano, with you standing at its base. 

There are plenty of houses, and streets and pathways and suspended walkways. 

Countless little openings dot the rocky walls, leading who knows where.

actions.answer:
Gentle lights illuminate the main roads. Many other lights peeks out the windows of the dwellings. 
Those houses have a similar shape: round earthen walls covered by an hemispheric dome made of something like straw. 

You feel odd, as if somebody is watching you.

You follow Math silently. Your steps resonate on the stone. 

All is quiet, but the air seems to be permeated with a subtle... $csinging?##$y
At the very edge of your hearing threshold, you think of hearing a melodic whispering,
many voices yet no voice at all, coming and going like they were carried around by the shifting movement of the air.

The lights along the main road are huge torches, emanating a noticeable warmth along with light. 
Sparkles ascend, carried by the warm air, dancing around and then extinguishing in the dark. 

You start to notice some dwellers showing themselves,
some along the streets, others looking out the windows. 
All of them are observing you with the same moderate interest. 

After a while, you stop at the base of a little hill, or mound.

nodes.text:
$m"This is the Elder's house, the wise Long. He is expecting you."$C

All of you look at Math repeatedly. 
After few instants you realize he is inviting you to enter. 

So this must be the one in command of this place, or something like that, you think.

choices.desc: You followed Math so far. Now, get inside that house? Why not?
Are you supposed to just comply? Let's go exploring this place instead.

nodes.text:
Without further notice, you turn your back to Math, nodding briefly to Corolla, and start walking. 

The others hesitate just a little, then start to following you. 
Math does not seem to care. 

$R"Hey where are you going now?"#$C Corolla whispers to you from behind your back. 
You don't know why, but you feel compelled to whisper as well when you answer:

$c"I just want to take a look around..."#$C You have the impression she wants to answer something,
but she just sighs as you all keep walking. 

The scenery is pretty boring after a while. 
The apparently chaotic network of little streets, passageways,
buildings ranging from little huts to big houses like the Elder's one,
after few minutes everything seems to just repeat itself. 
You don't meet anyone, and with the passing of time you start to feel a bit... stupid?

Anyway, all of a sudden, after a bend you see Math again. Has he come in search of you?#

Soon you realize he's still standing in the very same spot, smiling at you guys. 

Somehow you walked in a circle, returning right where you started.

Math looks at you as if nothing happened,
like it's perfectly natural to stand still there and keep on staring at you. 

Funnily, you don't know if you should feel more angry or more embarrassed.

choices.desc: No point in wasting more time... Let's see who this geezer is and what he has to say.
No way! You'll show them... Just keep moving!

nodes.text:
You keep your stride and move towards what looks like a new direction. 
You can hear the others murmuring, yet they keep on following you. 

You soon discover that the scenery goes back to repeating itself. 
And right when you think you're about to turn into an unexplored alley, you find him still there waiting for you. 

Math is still there, looking at you as if nothing happened. 

And, again, you don't know if you should feel more angry or more embarrassed. 

Some kind of trick has to be involved in this... 

It looks like you'll just have to do as you're told.

$c"Whoever this 'Elder' is, at least he will be able to tell us how to get back down safely..."$C
You conciliatory say, almost talking to yourself. 

$c"...maybe he will be able to tell us about the reason we climbed up here in the first place..."#$C You add, half aloud. 

$R"I have to say, it's not that much of a house... It looks like they don't care about hierarchy."

$CA feeble, flickering light comes from inside the house, like the light of candles. 

Suddenly, you all hear a warm and firm voice inviting you:

$M<<Please, get inside>>#

$CIt sounded like it came just from the midst of you. You exchange some puzzled looks. 
Smiurl is crouching on the ground, shoulders to the door. 

In the end, Theo decides for everybody and steps inside, opening with ease the light, creaky door.

You find yourself in a narrow corridor, its walls made of something resembling bamboo wood. 
Between the shadows, you get glimpses of small pieces of furniture, with many little objects on them. 

The light appears to be coming from the end of the passage. 
It does not look like it's coming from a candle anymore. 
It's bluish one moment, greenish the next one... 

You all walk behind Theo. You feel like you can hear Smiurl trembling behind you. 

You feel a weird sense of unreality. 
You catch yourself convulsively squeezing the hilt oh your sword. 

$c<<It's an instinctive reaction.>># $C You think. 

$c<<I don't even know how to use it.>># $C You think. 

Suddenly, the corridor ends around Theo's silhouette,
and the light suddenly lowers, going back to a more natural candlelight. 

You see an old man sitting on an armchair, his back turned on you. 
You can understand he's old because of the silver mane flowing down on his shoulders. 

He slowly turns around, and, in the same voice you heard outside, he says:

$M"Have a seat please. I've just finished brewing some tea"

dialogues.precomment:
You are the first one to comply. You feel you can trust that old man. 
Reading your thoughts, the Elder looks at you and says:
dialogues.line:
Be careful, young man. Never give your complete trust so easily... 
Just because I'm old, it doesn't necessarily mean you have nothing to fear.
dialogues.comment:
You hear his voice, yet he hasn't opened his mouth to speak. He just stared at you. 
His words spring up directly in your mind. You can't believe it. 
You remain silent, staring at him, sitting in your little wicker armchair, mouth half-open.

dialogues.precomment: Smiurl notices it, and shakes out of silence:
dialogues.line: He's ipnotising him!# Help!# Help!
dialogues.comment:
He tries to run away. 
The Elder glances at Theo, whom extends his arm, grabbing the little guy by his collar,
then lifting him from the ground, all without taking his eyes off the old man stare.

dialogues.precomment: Then the Elder look at Smiurl, and adds smiling warmly:
dialogues.line: Be quiet, little Smiurl. No harm will come to you.
dialogues.comment:
Surprisingly enough, Smiurl seems to accept that reassurance. 
Apparently, he doesn't even notice he has been called by name without anybody introducing him first.

dialogues.precomment:
Corolla sits next to you, dragging along Smiurl as well. 
Theo remains standing.

replies.line: You all want to know what place is this.
What is the real reason you are here?

dialogues.line: Dear Elder, where are we?

dialogues.precomment:
He observes with a gently amused expression the glare in her eyes. 
Then, chuckling, getting comfortable in his seat, he answers:
dialogues.line: Said and done: welcome to Seer's Rock.

dialogues.precomment: Theo sighs. Then he says:
dialogues.line: This we know... Math.
dialogues.comment: He nods to the outside.

dialogues.line: Well, actually, there's no need to add anything else.
dialogues.comment: He says with his mouth shut.

dialogues.precomment: You are getting used to this. You answer aloud right away:
dialogues.line: But... What does that mean?
Oh, I beg your pardon!# I think aloud all the time!
dialogues.comment: He exclaims.

dialogues.line: Yes, yes, I see you do not know the history of this place. Let me tell it for you.
dialogues.comment: After this, he takes a breath, then starts talking.

dialogues.line: I had you brought here, because you know, we were expecting you.
dialogues.comment: The Elder says.

dialogues.line: Can you see who traverses the desert from up here?
Of course..!
dialogues.comment:
And he looks somewhere in the distance in front of him, for a few moments. 

Then he changes expression abruptly:

dialogues.line: But no, no!# You fool, we have been waiting for centuries!# I mean...
dialogues.comment:
He adjusts his position,
settling more comfortably on his armchair, as he proceeds to clarify:

dialogues.line:
Few years ago, right after I was elected Elder, I was studying the memories of The Master himself. 
This happened only lately because the Underground Library is only accessible to the Elders. 
Anyway, I came across the description of a weird dream or vision. 
The details are not clear, but few things are unmistakable:
a wonderful, gold-haired girl, in a halo of light, gave a message to The Master. 
He then arranged for it to be passed down in time from Elder to Elder. 
I read in those memories about the very day and place where a group of visitors would have appeared. 
And the group would have consisted of a $cyoung man$M, a $Ydwarf$M, a $Btall man$M, and a $Rwoman$M". 

"To be honest, it reminds me of an Earthers' legend...
dialogues.comment:
His voice fades and he starts to space out again. 
Then he comes back to here and now and says:

dialogues.line:
Well, now it's clear the message is about you, today, and here. 
The Master commanded to give you hospitality and to assist you,
and you can be sure we will carry out our duty!

nodes.text:
He tells you that this place owes its name to its founder, a man called 'The Seer', or 'The Master'. 
He was the last of the psychic scholars living on Noi-Hert. 

A few decades after the Earthers' abandonment, being on the run, he sought refuge from the unrest here. 
And he found shelter indeed, at the top of this narrow yet superb spike of stone,
which stands lonely in the middle of the Great Desert. 

Safe from the hordes' attacks, he set up a community which in time continued to teach the psychic arts to its members. 
Up to this day, they live simple lives:
they use to farm a few exemplars of an animal species with a thick skin which uses to roam the desert in small herds. 
They also grow a herb or cereal that can grow anywhere it finds a handful of soil,
from which they obtain a weird, fine flour. 

The water need is met by a well at the bottom of a pit in the middle of the spire,
which goes down several kilometers and reaches deep underground# (at least this is what the Elder claims). 

The eldest and most skilled telepath between them is appointed as 'Elder Telepath', or just 'Elder'. 
That title rewpresents the authority in the village. 
Anyway# (as the Elder claims)# the election of an Elder is a sporadic event,
since they have an average life span of 200 years. 

Then the old man falls silent, and goes back to sip his tea.

The Elder falls silent, going back to sipping his tea, with evident satisfaction. 

You look at him as he smiles,
and as he apparently absent-mindedly casts his eyes as looking at a distant, far away landscape only he can see. 

It looks like he does not notice you anymore,
or like he does not care anymore you are still there.

choices.desc: You all want to know what place is this.
What is the real reason you are here?
A prophecy? A golden-haired... 'fairy'? Come on... What would we be supposed to do?

nodes.text:
The Elder prevents all of you from making any other question with a simple gesture of his hand. 
He then stands up, and says:

$M"You sure are tired. Math, please take them to their designed accommodation."

$CMath appears, seemingly out of thin air, emerging from the shadows of the corridor. 

You follow him outside, then you all walk quietly to one of the many houses in the surroundings. 
He tells you that a certain young woman named Efeliah left it free for you. 

As you enter the house, suddenly exhaustion hits you hard as stone. 
You collapse on one of the beds, unable to notice anything around you. 
The only thing you are vaguely aware of is the thankfulness you feel for this girl who owns this place... 

Your consciousness slips away in a rush,
as you fall deeply asleep on what feels like the most comfortable bed you've ever layed on.

###You get waken up by the noise of activity in the village. 
You feel rested, but still a bit groggy. 

Light comes through the windows, you have no idea what time it is or how long you've been asleep. 
Smiurl seems to be awake, sitting on a tidy bed, fully dressed.

dialogues.line: What time is it..?
dialogues.comment: You mumble slurring.

dialogues.line: The sun is quite high... I think it's past midday.
dialogues.comment: He shrugs his shoulders.

dialogues.precomment: He must be thinking you need the toilet: he points to one of the doors and clarifies:
dialogues.line: Theo is in the bathroom.

dialogues.precomment: At that sound, the mound of blankets on a bed on the other side of the room comes to life.
dialogues.line: My turn first!
dialogues.comment: You hear Corolla's muffled voice from underneath the pile of bedsheets. She immediately adds:

dialogues.line: ...I'm starving...!
dialogues.comment:
You can't help chuckling, hearing her tone. 

But then you become suddenly aware of your own stomach. 
At that, you also start noticing the smell of food (roasted meet) in the air. 

You start salivating vigorously.

nodes.text:
Someone knocks at the door. 
Math does not wait for your answer, and just utters from behind the door:

dialogues.line: Goodmorning friends!# Feel free to come outside whenever you are ready.
Meal is almost ready
dialogues.comment: He announces, as he rubs his face with the towel hanging from his neck.

dialogues.line: Let's not leave our hosts waiting for us...
dialogues.comment:
Corolla crawls out of bed, and enters the bathroom. 
She's wearing just her shirt. Her legs are quite muscular and good-looking, and you notice several scars on them. 

Then the door slams. 

All you can do now is waiting your turn.

nodes.text:
The room you slept in is very simple, and constitutes the majority of the humble house. 
It looks like they brought in extra beds in order to provide you with that improvised common room. 

When all of you are ready, you go outside to meet Math. A young woman is standing next to him.

dialogues.line: Goodmorning. I hope you rested well.

dialogues.precomment: Corolla smiles and answers, bowing slightly:
dialogues.line: Naturally. Your hospitality is delightful.
Let me introduce to you Efeliah. She offered her house for you.
dialogues.comment: He adds after reciprocating the courtesy.

dialogues.precomment:
She steps forward. She's slightly taller than Corolla. You start noticing how in the village everybody is quite tall. 
She has wavy, platinum blonde hair, flowing down to her shoulder blades. 
Her eyes are $ggreen$C, a very light, pale green. And very beautiful too. 
Like everybody else around them, she's wearing a simple, plain tunic, made with a light-coloured fabric.
dialogues.line: It is my pleasure to welcome you, on behalf of the whole village.
dialogues.comment: Another bow.

dialogues.line: Now, if you don't mind following me, the banquet is waiting for you, not to mention how hungry you must be...
dialogues.comment: She pauses, intently looking at each one of you, squinting her eyes.# Then she continues:

dialogues.line: ...I see the last time you ate was yesterday morning... Please come this way.
dialogues.comment:
She concludes,
inviting you to follow her once more with a gesture of her hand. You happily comply.

nodes.text: Efeliah takes you under her arm. Her hand is warm, and you can smell her natural scent.

dialogues.line: Tonight the Elder is going to give a speech.
dialogues.comment: She says.

dialogues.line: What about?
dialogues.comment: You muster to ask back.

dialogues.line: I believe he wants to surprise you.
dialogues.comment:
You aren't sure of it, but you feel like Math is trying to suppress a smile. 
On top of that, over his words you can distinctly hear his voice saying, or rather thinking:

dialogues.line: ...about you/us...
dialogues.comment: You instinctively turn around, looking puzzled at your friends.

dialogues.line: Everything okay?
Erm... Yeah, I suppose so...
dialogues.comment:
You smile, slightly embarrassed. 
You look away, and you notice the Elder's house. He's watching out the window. 
You feel like he's looking right at you.

dialogues.line: Indeed.
dialogues.comment: He answers your thoughts with his usal 'voice'. You wonder if you could ever get used to it.

dialogues.line: Why do I worry?# Not that I dislike these guys... But sooner or later we'll leave this place...
I wouldn't be so sure of many things...
dialogues.comment:
He answers into your mind once again. 
You quickly glance at his place, resentfully. It looks like he's retracted inside the house. 

You continue walking, Efeliah still at your arm.

nodes.text:
You reach the central square of the village. As you walk, every single person you see either greets you all,
or smiles, or bows slightly, or a combination of the three. You start to feel embarrassed. 

Finally, you reach the square. It is modest, but quite spacious for the local standards. 
Torches have been lit and placed all around. In the middle, a huge brazier with a massive grill on it. 
And some even more massive pieces of meat are placed on it, roasting invitingly,
the fat dripping and crackling when it touches the flames. 

On the right side, a long table with many chairs has been prepared. 
On the left, a kiosk has been set up, with many drinks and some people to serve them. 

On the opposite side in front of you, you see a kind of wooden podium. 

There are so many things you want to ask.
nodes.altText:
You are still in the square with the others. As time passes, more people are joining you. 
After all the care received, Smiurl seems calmer. He's even starting conversations with some of your hosts. 

The Elder still hasn't shown up. 
It seems you have some more time to enjoy the party.

objects.answer: $m"The cooks are giving the best of themselves tonight. Special courses are being prepared for you guys."$y
$g"Please, have a drink before anything else. I'm sure you'll be surpised!"$y

That must be where official announcements are made. It looks small and modest like everything else. 
The Elder will surely climb those wooden steps soon.

actions.answer: You all stand there quietly. It looks like there is still time before the meal. You should take advantage now to ask some questions. These guys TALK WITH THEIR MINDS. How's that possible??

condition.refusal: Food is not yet being served. Maybe I could have something to drink in the meantime.
I should honor our hosts enjoying what has been prepared for us.

dialogues.precomment: Smiurl must have had the same idea, as you hear him asking:
dialogues.line: How can you guys make thoughts speak?# What spells do you use?

dialogues.precomment: Math chuckles heartily. He starts explaining with a smile:
dialogues.line:
It's not magic..!# As the Master teaches: 'telepathy is an innate faculty of human minds', dormant at birth. 
And like any other skill, it requires excercise, effort, and study.

dialogues.precomment: He has taken on a more solemn expression. Smiurl is definitely incredulous.
dialogues.line:
You see, when you think of something, when you speak, anytime you do something, even when you sleep,
inside your brain millions of chemical reaction take place. Each of them has a certain 'energy signature'. 
A trained mind is able to catch and discern the meaning of these emissions, that's all...

These signals exists especially in specific dimensions of this universe;
inside 'classic' spacetime, they are very weak and get overshadowed by natural radiation.
dialogues.comment:
#

You are fascinated by his explanation. He sounds exactly like one of the characters in the sci-fi books you use to read. 
Back home, on Earth. 

As you experience that painful thought, Math and Efeliah turn suddenly towards you,
as if they heard a loud noise. 

You smile. Maybe you do can get used to this.

dialogues.precomment: You go to the drinks kiosk. A smiling guy welcomes you:
dialogues.line: What would you like to try?
Not sure... What do you suggest?
dialogues.comment: Corolla answers first.

dialogues.line:
I promise, everything you see is delicious. 
Anyway, what I like the most are these cocktails with Pinzerro flavoured Martee'nee.
What did you just said??# 'Martini'?
dialogues.comment: You exclaim surprised.

dialogues.line: Yes, it's an old recipe, but...
Incredible...
dialogues.comment: The first link with your world and this, is booze. Corolla looks at you puzzled.

dialogues.line: I wonder how do they obtain it...
dialogues.comment: You think to yourself.

dialogues.line: We'll take two of those then, please!
dialogues.comment:
She then looks back at you. You smile reassuringly, coming back to present. 

The drink is actually extremely good. You can't pinpoint the exact taste of it,
but it could totally be one in the infinite number of cocktails from Earth. 

Your spirits are a little higher now...

dialogues.precomment:
As you approach the long table, you are invited to take a seat around the head of the table,
where in the meantime the Elder went to sit. 

As soon as you are all ready, a waiter arrives with the first course.
dialogues.line: This is for Mr. Smiurl.

dialogues.precomment:
He put down a silvery plate on the table in front of the dwarf. 
Then he uncovers it for him, and Smiurl literally burst out with a flash of delight. 
He can't even wait and instantly put a finger into the reddish sauce to get a taste:
dialogues.line: Sand-fruit with scrambled Croeggs!# Mmmmm... So delightful!# And this is true Ghermina Sauce!

dialogues.precomment:
You stare at him, marveled. As Smiurl keeps eating, he keeps on lighting up like a firefly,
going from $Yyellow$C to $Bblue$C, $Yinter$Bmitten$Ytly$C. 

Then comes your turn. Another plate is put in front of you. For a second, you try peek at its contents,
but soon it gets uncovered by the waiter, as he announces:
dialogues.line: For Mr. Kriss, 'Earthers' Steaks'
dialogues.comment:
From his tone, you understand they must be proud of their creation. 
And, you have to admnit, it does look familiar. 
It could be something you use to eat with your family and friends around your barbecue. 

Suddenly, you are struck by melancholy again. You haven't even had the time to think about or miss home. 
The place you left only about three days ago.

dialogues.precomment: Math notices your thoughts, not just your expression, and brings you back by asking:
dialogues.line: Something's wrong?# You can't eat this food?
No, not at all... I am sure it's excellent...

dialogues.precomment:
Then you grab what must be the local version of a fork, and stab a huge, juicy piece of meat. 
You stuff it in your mouth, chewing energetically. 
After few seconds, you look at Math and the waiter again,
doing your best in an attempt to smile with your mouth still full, then venturing to say:
dialogues.line: ...HAB-FO-LUTELY..!
dialogues.comment:
#And, at that, everybody bursts out laughing, including Theo and the Elder.#

The rest of the dinner goes smoothly, sharing jokes and tales with each other. 

After a while, you all stand up again, while conversations continue. 

Then the Elder climbs up the little podium, so everybody falls quiet, waiting for his speech.

dialogues.line: Hello you all again, friends and guests.
dialogues.comment:
The Elder starts abruptly. He's talking normally, in a quiet voice,
and he's irradiating his verbal thoughts at the same time. A weird 'stereo' broadcasting. 
There's people in the distance following his speech from the windows of their houses, after all.

dialogues.precomment:
He then tells everybody the same story you already heard, only with many more details. 
The secret mission the Master left for them, long time ago... 

You get a bit distracted hearing all of that once more. Your eyes wonder and you watch the sky. 
You see the moon, well, 'A' moon. You realize it's the first time you see it:
a thin scythe, a different shade from the Earth's moon, and a little bigger. 
You didn't notice it was already dark; you were distracted before,
hence you could not see the night smuggling off the sun, again. 

You go back to listening to the Elder, and what he says now surprises you, to say the least:
dialogues.line:
...to better fulfill our obligation, and to ensure the success and safety of our guests,
two of us volounteered to escort them... In order to meet their fate.
dialogues.comment:
He waves his hand briefly at you all. 

As he falls silent for a little, you look at Math and Efeliah. They are smiling. 

Theo grunts a little, expressing something that must lie more or less halfway between approval and doubt. 

Smiurl lights up, maybe with excitement, maybe in fear.

dialogues.line:
I thereby officially entrust this mission to Math Fraimann and Efeliah Amas. 
They will go with Kriss, Corolla, Theo and Smiurl, wherever our guests will want, or need.

dialogues.precomment:
The Elder bows, signaling the end of his speech. A murmur of voices and thoughts rises. 
Efeliah and Math turn towards you guys smiling. Corolla smiles back and says:
dialogues.line: We are truly honored. First the hospitality, then this...
dialogues.comment: She waves her hand referring to what just happened.

dialogues.line: Are you sure you want to do this?
dialogues.comment:
From her thoughts seeps out:

$R<<If I were in your shoes, I would think it twice...!>>$C

dialogues.line: No need to worry about that Corolla, I can assure you we did think it through.

dialogues.precomment: Hearing that, Corolla gets more serious, and adds, bowing slightly in the manner of your hosts:
dialogues.line: Then we are pleased to welcome you.
